title: Can something be done about Caiyltn already?
body:
Seriously, she's been chunking people for half their fucking health with just an IE for at least 5 patches, at most I'd say around 10. The last time she had a balance change was 6.4, which was back in **February.** That's possibly almost 10 months of being chunked by this bitch when she only has one item.

Here's some ideas

* Make her traps disappear under towers 10 seconds after being placed
* Nerf the damage scaling on her W headshot empowerment from 70% AD to 60% or 50%
* Remove headshot damage scaling off of crit chance
* Remove pointless bonus attack speed on passive
* Make her traps not reveal you for _nine fucking seconds_ and instead  for something like 5 seconds

And she should be okay.

Her ultimate is whatever, but none can deny the overall potency of a point and click super long ranged spell.

A targeted, long ranged, point and click undodgeable, high damage spell will never be bad.
Nid's traps get spoiled by minions.  Teemo shrooms and Jhin's flowers get revealed by towers so you can destroy them.  Neither of those things are true about Cait's traps.

These skills have different purposes, though. Nidalee is a jungler, if her traps wouldn't react to creeps (or in her case: jungle monsters) it would affect her clearing. Because she just has her spear to tag the monsters for the skill reset then. And Nidalee can place her traps in bushes in her jungle, to get vision for a counter jungler and marking him for extra benefits to punish him.

Teemo Shrooms and Jhin's flowers are invisible and are actually meant for different tasks. Like making an ambush for the enemy, letting him step in the traps for burst damage and then follow up. And they can be used as an escape tool. Especially Jhin should place these traps the way he wants to escape through, so his following enemies step on them and he can follow up with his W to snare them, giving himself a speed buff and dealing damage. That's why they are invisible, because if they weren't, they wouldn't function for ambushes and escapes.

The purpose of Caitlyn's traps is totally different. They should be used as area denial and for sieging power. If minions would activate them, the traps would have absolutely 0 sieging power. Same if they would be destroyable. You have to keep in mind how the skill is meant to be used, you can't just blindly compare them to each other and say "that champion doesn't have it, so that champion shouldn't either!".

Nidalee's traps have worked that way since well before she was a jungler. So, that's not a good argument. 

Jhin's traps activate his W, but they activate on minions. I'd say that's not a very good argument either. Cait's traps allow her to burst people too you do understand that? She gets a free long range headshot out of it. 

Cait already has the longest AA range in the game, and she can hold off an entire team just because of traps and the AA range when they activate. That's flat out unfun and it's unfair.

Nidalee's traps worked like that since before she was a jungler, correct. In that time, Riot wasn't really focusing on giving all champions unique niches to fulfill, so that is no good argument for me as well. She is meant as a jungler now and will be balanced around that. The functionality that the traps trigger on creeps has to stay because of that.

I didn't elaborate enough about Jhin it seems. Right now, Jhin's traps are used for the following tasks:
- ambushes
- escapes
- wave clear
I missed out the last one, sorry for that. Jhin's wave clear is pretty bad, especially if there are really big waves. He has a wave clear tool with his Q, but it will just kill 4 minions. If you have to clear a big wave, you will likely use his traps to kill the minions. With that functionality, his traps still can be used as escapes, you just have to place them at places minions usually are not walking through.

His traps are not area denial or sieging power. The fact that they are invisible contradicts the use as area denial and they are visible and destructable in tower range, so they don't function for sieges.

That's what I mean. Now look at Caitlyn's traps. She doesn't need them for wave clear, that's what her Q is for. They are clearly designed to deny walking paths for enemies and giving her the strength at sieging, which is her whole design.

Of course I understand that she gets a long ranged headshot for them. That's why they work in sieging and controlling the movement of the enemy. They are punishing the enemy for stepping in them. If you make them targetable in tower range, they simply don't do anymore what they are actually designed for.

You may think it is unfun and unfair.... I disagree. Sieging is her main strength (that's why she has long range, she is a **siege** adc), the weakness for that playstyle is breaking the siege with flanking. I think she is managable, I never felt helpless against a Caitlyn. But maybe that is just me.

Or you could stop being bad and walking on clearly obvious flashing red traps.

(She basically isn't plagued by any weakness that other marksmen have ---like a bad early/mid/late game, short range, no poke, immobile etc...) 

Its like she gets to do and be good at everything as far as marksmen go, while even being the BEST at some things on top of it (dat 650 base range)

She might not be broken, but there's little denying that Jhin is far more manageable in playing against than a Caitlin, to add onto Chaddy's point about forcing him to cancel his ult, he's right, if he's forced to cancel, not only does it go on full CD, but two other crucial aspects:

He doesn't get his 4th shot off - where the good majority of his damage comes from in his ultimate.

If he is using his ult, that means he's screens away from where the fight is occuring, if you force him to cancel, that means he's done. He's not getting back into that fight until its mostly over, and when you're the ADC and the main source of damage, this becomes the nail in the coffin for if a team with Jhin wins a fight or not. 

I've seen Jhin's use it to open up in the begin for engages sure, but honestly, the overall impact of using it to engage feels weak. I've also have seen him use it to try and pick off stragglers, which at that point, becomes a mind game, again, nothing wrong with that. 

Sure your top laner or mid laner might be going for him, but they typically won't be the highest DPS output barring maybe a Syndra (but wtf would a Syndra be doing near Jhin ulting from off screen?)

Jhin is strong, no doubt about it, but he also has his weaknesses on full display as well and no matter how much of a god you are with Jhin, you will never be able to conceal them, ever. Additionally, he falls off late game: the point in the game where everyone knows when late game has arrived. 

As an assassin or even as a support, your window of killing him is clear: wait for him to ult or wait for him to use his 4th shot in which he has two seconds in which he can not fight back. Additionally, he's not going to be able to burn through four bullets to kill you before you kill him as an assassin. If you jump on him then, he's dead. Simple as that. 

Caitlin on the other hand, while she has her weaknesses, are a lot easier to hide, especially by someone who plays her well or for a long time. For an assassin, it's far more ambiguous in when to kill her or how. Her main weakness is a weak mid game - but mid-game power is often times difficult to assess by the average player. 

And also, lets be clear: the question at hand is not about Caitlyn being broken, almost none of these threads have actually been venting about her being broken, its about frustration, two completely different things.
